SEARCH
Package Model

Class OrderExecutionPhase

java.lang.Object
Model.Phase
Model.OrderExecutionPhase
public class OrderExecutionPhase extends Phase
Represents the Order Execution Phase in the game. Handles the execution of player orders, checks for end of game, and transitions to the next phase.
Author:
Shrey Hingu

  • Method Details

    • initPhase

      public void initPhase()
      Initializes and manages the order execution phase loop, executes player orders, displays the map, checks for game end, and transitions to the next phase based on user input.
      Specified by:
      initPhase in class Phase

    • checkEndOfGame

      public boolean checkEndOfGame(CurrentState p_currentState)
      Checks whether the game has ended by verifying if a player (excluding Neutral) owns all the countries on the map.
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - the current game state.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended and a player has won; false otherwise.

    • executeOrders

      private void executeOrders()
      Executes the next order for each player in the current state, looping until all players have no more orders to execute. Also logs the execution of each order.

    • addNeutralPlayer

      private void addNeutralPlayer(CurrentState p_currentState)
      Adds a Neutral player to the game state if one does not already exist. The Neutral player is used to hold conquered territories with no owner.
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - the current game state.
